author: Tom Lydon
title: Some Positive ESG Trends Emerged in 2023
text:
Environmental, social and governance (ESG) investing endured political controversies, regulatory scrutiny and tepid fund-level demand in 2023. But obituaries weren’t penned for ESG this year, nor should they have been.
After all, exchange traded funds such as the (
QQMG ) notched stellar showings this year. Those were helped in large part by growth stock leadership. Obviously, investing is a bottom-line endeavor and performance is what matters most at the end of the day. But some other positive ESG trends emerged this year. Some of those may be underappreciated with 2023 drawing to a close.
For example, data confirms that more U.S.-based companies, including QQMG member firms, are stepping up to the plate and making improved ESG reporting a priority. Those efforts could pave the way for broader adoption of ESG exchange traded funds.
ESG Reporting Trending in Right Direction
It could prove constructive that more corporations are making efforts on the ESG reporting front.
“Despite challenges and the
recent ESG backlash, companies remain committed to the work of ESG and CSR. Recent data supports the continued relevance of ESG and CSR practices, underlying their critical role in risk mitigation and financial success. A June 2023 study from the Center for Audit Quality found that ESG reporting among the S&P 500 is now approximately 99%,” reported EHS Today.
While QQMG’s methodology is clear and easy to understand, that’s a status not shared across the landscape of ESG ETFs. There’s also a lack of uniformity regard ESG ratings and reporting. Those factors are headwinds to broader ESG ETF adoption.
Fortunately, those scenarios are expected to improve as soon as next year. Plus, there are other emerging ESG tailwinds that could be supportive of funds such as QQMG. For example, data indicates more high-ranking executives view ESG as a value-add, while others see merit in committing to more ESG efforts.
“Contrary to the narrative that companies are scaling back or abandoning ESG and CSR, most are continuing to prioritize progress towards their social impact goals. According to KPMG’s 2023 CEO Outlook report, 69% of CEOs have embedded ESG into their business as a means of value creation,” added EHS Today. “They also recognize that there is more work to do. 68% indicate that their current ESG progress is not yet strong enough to withstand the scrutiny of stakeholders and shareholders. But progress won’t continue if resources are not commensurate with the expected growth.”
For more news, information, and analysis, visit the
ETF Education Channel.

author: balancin
title: #41 Nieves Concostrina: "No hubo ningún San Valentín, es un cuento inventado por la Iglesia Católica"
text:
Nieves Concostrina: "No hubo ningún San Valentín, es un cuento inventado por la Iglesia Católica"
por a publicado:
La historia oficiosa data del siglo III, en el que el emperador romano Marco Aurelio Claudio prohibió el matrimonio entre soldados. "Hasta los mismos miembros de la multinacional católica lo descatalogaron en el 1969. No hubo ningún San Valentín. Fueron tres santos. Se lo han ido inventando. El Vaticano se encontró con tres al que llamaban San Valentín, ninguno documentado". Esta festividad la inventó el cristianismo para sustituir las fiestas paganas por las suyas. "El 15 de febrero se celebraban las lupercales.
#laventana|
#16ni la Navidad, que nada tiene que ver con Jesús, que como personaje histórico, con lo que ellos mismos cuentan, nacería como a finales de Marzo. Sus padre estaban censándose en Belén, y el censo era en marzo... Por eso pudieron quedarse a dormir en un portalón. Primero de abril, a lo sumo.
#4Y San Juan, que existió pero no tiene nada que ver con la llegada del verano.
#10y eso en sus ratos libres, su trabajo principal es vender nueces
#5Claro que fueron tres santos, Sam Va Lentín!
#8Dramatización:
#2La Biblia está llena de personajes y lugares que nunca existieron de los que no hay ninguna constancia arqueológica, pero por política se toma como fuente "histórica" e "historia" de un pueblo. Como los personajes de Don Quijote, que son pura ficción aunque Cervantes se inspirara en algún conocido, o las historias que suceden en Macondo que cuenta la historia de ese pueblo pero aunque esos relatos tengan correlación con la historia politica de Colombia, Cien años de Soledad no deja de ser una novela y el libro de un genio universal.
#7Luego esta Borges que es convertir las mates discretas y teoria de conjuntos en novela.
#7No compares la literatura con la religión. Las novelas hacen poco o ningún mal. Sin embargo el creador de una religión, y todo lo que significa construirla, nunca podría ser considerado un genio, sino un vulgar psicópata.
#15No es comparar literatura con religión, es quitarle a textos imaginarios como la Biblia su carácter histórico por motivos políticos.
#17Mi madre cumple 75 años el 14 de febrero y siempre dice que cuando ella era pequeña no se decía nada de San Valentín por su cumpleaños, que es una moda que vino bastante después. Nada de religión. Es como el papa noel de rojo de Coca Cola.
#17La Iglesia católica española tiene tantos santos y vírgenes que que roza el paganismo, y luego lo que se hace con ellos en semana santa ya es el esperpento.
#18Estaba poniendo los chistes malos en bandeja y no los ha hecho nadie. En fin, es esto;
es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Día_blanco
#6Jose tenía más cuernos que el buey
#6¿Que es el día blanco ? (En serio, no lo sé y tengo curiosidad).
#18Tanta curiosidad no tendrás cuando no lo has buscado en Google como acabo de hacer yo ahora.
[es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Día_blanco](https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Día_blanco)

[aquí.](https://www.meneame.net/register.php)

author: PA News Agency
title: Off-road drivers were swept away by river, says man who tried to save them | York Press
text: A man who tried to save three men trapped in a submerged 4×4 vehicle said they were “swept away” as they attempted to cross a river. Emergency services including police, ambulance and a helicopter attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday. A 4×4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside had died, North Yorkshire Police said. Chris Ford, who lives nearby, told the PA news agency the men were part of an off-roading group when they crossed a ford on Rake Lane. The river, swollen by heavy rain, swept them away and carried them around 400 yards downstream, he said. It came as Storm Gerrit caused flooding and travel chaos across the country throughout Wednesday and Thursday. Mr Ford, a firewood salesman, was called to the scene to help recover the vehicle with his tractor and found it fully submerged beneath the water, he said. He and two others used tractors to pull the 4×4 on to the riverbank, he said. Police said another man, who attempted to help those trapped in the car, was pulled from the river and needed medical treatment. Mr Ford told PA: “There was a ford they were going over and they were swept down 400 yards. “They were part of an off-road club. “I went down with my tractor. There was a couple of vehicles – one parked up. “You couldn’t see the (other) vehicle. It was 3ft beneath the water. “I helped get it out on to the riverbank with three other tractors.” Two other locals, Rosie and Andrew Dale, said they were with Mr Ford when he got the call to help. They said they saw several 4×4 vehicles pass their home in the direction of the ford shortly before the incident. Mrs Dale said “nobody local” would attempt to cross the ford in the current conditions. The area is popular with 4×4 drivers, she said, adding: “In the summer you get 10 of them at a time.” A spokesperson for North Yorkshire Police said: “Localised conditions across our area are making driving hazardous. “Roads are particularly badly affected around the River Esk, to the north of the county, as we have seen with the tragic incident near Glaisdale. “There was another incident at nearby Houlsyke at 12.49pm when a car got stuck in flood water and another at Kirby Wiske in Hambleton at 2.35pm. “Thankfully, the occupants of both vehicles were brought to safety. “The key advice is to consider whether your journey is necessary. “Please avoid driving through any kind of standing or moving flood water if you possibly can.” Witnesses to the incident at Glaisdale are urged to call North Yorkshire Police on 101, option 4, quoting reference NYP-28122023-0146. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments) Comments are closed on this article

author: Reuters News Service
title: Erdogan offers to host Ukraine-Russia peace summit after meeting Zelenskiy
text:
Turkey is ready to host a summit between Ukraine and Russia to end the war, President Tayyip Erdogan said on Friday after talks with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Istanbul.
In a meeting lasting about an hour, Erdogan and Zelenskiy discussed developments in the Ukraine-Russia war, shipping security in the Black Sea including the defunct grain deal, and defence industry cooperation, according to the two sides.
NATO member Turkey supports Ukraine’s territorial integrity, but also maintains cordial relations with Russia, and regularly speaks with both sides in the conflict, notably as a sponsor of the Black Sea deal that lifted a de facto Russian blockade of Ukrainian grain exports.
“We discussed developments about the war in detail today, I stated our observations with all my sincerity,” Erdogan said at a press conference alongside Zelenskiy, whose trip comes before an expected visit by Russian President Vladimir Putin following elections in Russia on March 15-17.
“We are giving our utmost contribution for the war to end on the basis of negotiations. We are ready to host a peace summit that Russia will attend too,” he said, adding he had reiterated Ankara’s support for Ukraine’s sovereignty.
Turkey had hosted peace talks between Russia and Ukraine in 2022, but has since complained that no diplomatic step has been taken to advance these discussions. It has repeatedly offered to host further talks, saying a summit of leaders was needed.
Zelenskiy said Russia would not be invited to the first peace summit due to be held in Switzerland in the coming months, but that a Russian representative could be invited to the next meeting after a roadmap for peace had been agreed upon with Ukrainian allies.
“We do not see any representatives of Russia at this summit. We don’t see how you can invite people who block, destroy, and kill everything. We want to get a result – a just peace,” he said.
Last week, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said after meeting Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov that it was time for Ukraine and Russia to start ceasefire talks, but added that this must not mean the recognition of Russia’s occupation.
DEFENCE INDUSTRY COOPERATION
Turkey has provided Ukraine with armed drones and also inked an agreement for their joint production at a factory near Kyiv, but progress has been hindered by the war. It has provided Kyiv with other forms of military support, but opposes the Western sanctions on Russia.
After arriving on Friday, Zelenskiy visited a shipyard near Istanbul to inspect construction work on two corvettes for the Ukrainian navy. He later said he had discussed the joint production of some arms and ammunition with Erdogan.
“Today, we have reached agreements on joint defence projects both at the government level and between companies,” he said on the social media platform X after meeting Erdogan.
“I met with the Turkish defence industry representatives. We are prepared to move quickly to put everything we discussed into action,” he added, without elaborating.
Talks also touched on the Black Sea grain deal, which was brokered by Turkey and United Nations and allowed Ukraine to safely export grain from its ports. Ankara has pushed to revive it, but Russia, which said its requests for better terms for its own food and fuel exports were ignored, has said it is not interested.
As part of its balancing act, Turkey maintains its defence industry ties with Ukraine while deepening energy cooperation with Russia. It also inked an accord to take part in the post-war reconstruction of Ukraine.
Reuters exclusively reported last month that a U.S. threat to hit financial firms doing business with Russia with sanctions had chilled Turkish-Russian trade, disrupting or slowing some payments for both imported oil and Turkish exports

author: Ejay Camposano
title: 11 Dog Breeds That Love Hot Weather
text: When choosing a dog, it’s important to consider the climate in which you live to ensure your furry friend will thrive in their environment. For those living in hot weather regions, selecting a dog breed that can handle and even enjoy higher temperatures is crucial. Some breeds are naturally better suited to warm climates due to their physical characteristics, such as a short coat, lean body, or even origins in hot regions. These dogs can remain comfortable and active despite the heat, making them ideal companions for people in warmer areas. This article explores eleven dog breeds that are well-suited to hot weather, detailing why each breed thrives in such climates and what makes them excellent pets. 11. Basenji Basenjis are a lesser-known breed originating from Central Africa, where they were used as hunting dogs. They are well-adapted to hot climates due to their short, fine coat, which provides minimal insulation, helping them stay cool. Basenjis are also known for their clean habits and minimal shedding, which makes them easy to care for in warm weather. These dogs are energetic and enjoy outdoor activities, which makes them perfect for hot climates where they can stay active year-round. Basenjis are also known for their unique yodel-like vocalization instead of barking, adding to their distinct charm. 10. Chihuahua Chihuahuas, originating from Mexico, are naturally suited to warm climates. Their small size and short coat make them ideal for hot weather, as they do not retain much body heat. Chihuahuas are very adaptable and enjoy basking in the sun. They are energetic and playful, yet they do not require extensive exercise, making them perfect for hot environments where long outdoor activities might be uncomfortable. Despite their small stature, Chihuahuas are bold and confident, often serving as excellent watchdogs. Their ability to thrive in warm weather, combined with their charming personalities, makes them popular pets in hot climates. 9. Dalmatian Dalmatians are known for their distinctive spotted coat and energetic nature. Originating from the Dalmatia region in Croatia, they have adapted well to various climates, including hot weather. Their short coat provides minimal insulation, which helps them stay cool in high temperatures. Dalmatians are highly active and require regular exercise, making them well-suited to environments where they can enjoy outdoor activities. Their playful and friendly nature makes them excellent companions for families and individuals who enjoy an active lifestyle. Dalmatians are also known for their endurance and stamina, making them great for long walks and runs in warmer weather. 8. Vizsla Vizslas are a breed that hails from Hungary, where they were used as hunting dogs. They are well-suited to hot weather due to their short, sleek coat that offers minimal insulation. Vizslas are highly energetic and require plenty of exercise, making them ideal for active owners living in warm climates. They enjoy activities such as running, hiking, and swimming, which help them stay cool and burn off energy. Vizslas are also known for their affectionate and loyal nature, forming strong bonds with their families. Their ability to thrive in hot weather, combined with their friendly and active disposition, makes them excellent companions. 7. Whippet Whippets, often known for their speed and agility, are another breed well-suited to hot weather. Originating from England, they have a short coat and lean body that help them stay cool in warm climates. Whippets are highly energetic and enjoy running, making them perfect for active owners who live in hot regions. They are known for their gentle and affectionate nature, getting along well with children and other pets. Whippets require regular exercise but are also content to relax at home, making them adaptable to various living situations. Their combination of speed, agility, and ability to handle heat makes them a great choice for warmer climates. 6. Pharaoh Hound Pharaoh Hounds are an ancient breed that originated in Malta and are well-adapted to hot weather. Their short coat and lean body help them stay cool in high temperatures. Pharaoh Hounds are known for their graceful appearance and hunting skills. They are energetic and require regular exercise, making them well-suited to active owners in warm climates. These dogs are also known for their affectionate and loyal nature, forming strong bonds with their families. Pharaoh Hounds enjoy outdoor activities and thrive in environments where they can stay active. Their ability to handle heat, combined with their elegant appearance, makes them a unique choice for hot weather regions. 5. Ibizan Hound Ibizan Hounds are another breed that thrives in hot weather. Originating from the Balearic Islands in Spain, they have a short, smooth coat and lean body that help them stay cool. Ibizan Hounds are highly energetic and enjoy running and jumping, making them ideal for active owners in warm climates. They are known for their playful and friendly nature, getting along well with children and other pets. Ibizan Hounds require regular exercise and enjoy outdoor activities, making them well-suited to environments where they can stay active. Their ability to handle heat, combined with their playful disposition, makes them excellent companions for hot weather. 4. Afghan Hound Afghan Hounds are known for their elegant appearance and long, flowing coats. Despite their luxurious coat, they are surprisingly well-adapted to hot weather due to their origins in the mountainous regions of Afghanistan, where temperatures can vary widely. Afghan Hounds have a single-layer coat that provides insulation from both heat and cold. They are highly energetic and enjoy running and playing, making them well-suited to active owners in warm climates. Afghan Hounds are known for their independent and dignified nature, forming strong bonds with their families. Their ability to handle heat, combined with their graceful appearance, makes them a unique and beautiful choice for hot weather regions. 3. Rhodesian Ridgeback Rhodesian Ridgebacks are a breed that originated in Africa, where they were used for hunting and guarding. They are well-suited to hot weather due to their short coat and robust build. Rhodesian Ridgebacks are highly energetic and require regular exercise, making them ideal for active owners in warm climates. They are known for their loyal and protective nature, forming strong bonds with their families. Rhodesian Ridgebacks enjoy outdoor activities and thrive in environments where they can stay active. Their ability to handle heat, combined with their strong and protective nature, makes them excellent companions for hot weather regions. 2. Australian Cattle Dog Australian Cattle Dogs, also known as Blue Heelers or Queensland Heelers, are a breed that thrives in hot weather. Originating from Australia, they were bred to herd cattle in harsh and hot conditions. Australian Cattle Dogs have a short, dense coat that protects them from the sun and heat. They are highly energetic and require regular exercise, making them ideal for active owners in warm climates. Australian Cattle Dogs are known for their intelligence and working ability, forming strong bonds with their families. They enjoy outdoor activities and thrive in environments where they can stay active. Their ability to handle heat, combined with their intelligence and working ability, makes them excellent companions for hot weather regions. 1. Canaan Dog Canaan Dogs are a lesser-known breed that is well-suited to hot weather. Originating from the Middle East, they were used as herding and guarding dogs in harsh desert conditions. Canaan Dogs have a short, dense coat that protects them from the sun and heat. They are highly energetic and require regular exercise, making them ideal for active owners in warm climates. Canaan Dogs are known for their intelligence and independence, forming strong bonds with their families. They enjoy outdoor activities and thrive in environments where they can stay active. Their ability to handle heat, combined with their intelligence and independence, makes them excellent companions for hot weather regions. In conclusion, these eleven dog breeds are well-suited to hot weather, offering many years of companionship and joy to their owners. Proper care, including regular exercise, a balanced diet, and routine veterinary check-ups, is essential to maintaining their health and ensuring they thrive in warm climates. Understanding the unique needs of each breed can help ensure they live long, happy lives, enriching the lives of their families with their presence.

author: 勁報
title: 南市府：丹娜絲災損補助標準 即日至8/15洽受災區所辦理
text:
南市府：丹娜絲災損補助標準 即日至8/15洽受災區所辦理
【勁報記者于郁金/臺南報導】為全力協助丹娜絲颱風災後重建復原，臺南市長黃偉哲指示市府團隊以災民需求為優先，針對風災造成的死亡、重傷、房屋毀損及車輛毀損泡水等情況，提出相關補助與慰助標準；臺南市府副秘書長尤天厚7月10日下午代表市長，率社會、民政、交通及工務局等相關局處說明災損補、慰助標準；自即日起至114年8月15日，民眾可檢附相關證明及單據向受災地區公所提出申請；黃偉哲也特別要求各區公所秉持「從速從簡」原則，加快審查流程，將補助金儘速送達災民手中，協助民眾盡早恢復正常生活。
針對丹娜絲颱風災損，臺南市政府提出6大補助與慰助標準，包括：
1、死亡救助：因災致死者，發給慰問金20萬元。
2、重傷救助：因災致重傷，且自付醫療費用超過10萬元者，補助10萬元。
3、安遷救助：因災害致住屋毀損達不堪居住之設籍且實際居住者，每人補助2萬元，每戶最高10萬元。
4、淹水救助：住屋淹水高度達50公分以上且有居住事實之現住者，每戶慰助金1萬5,000元。
5、建築物屋頂及外牆修繕補助，依建築物(住宅使用)屋頂及外牆損壞程度，檢附相關照片及修繕單據：
(1)建物之屋頂及外牆損壞程度超過20平方公尺以上、100平方公尺以下者；合法建築物補助1萬元，非合法建築物補助5千元。
(2)建物之屋頂及外牆損壞程度達超過100平方公尺以上者；合法建築物補助2萬元，非合法建築物補助1萬元。
6、車輛泡水或受外力毀損之慰助：針對汽車(含大型重機)補助1萬元、機車(含掛牌微型電動二輪車)補助2千元，以實際修理或減損金額補助。
臺南市政府說明，上述各項補助申請受理單位是37區的區公所，上班時間皆可受理，請民眾備妥文件向受災地區的區公所提出申請；停班停課行政區，也有應變中心輪值人員可受理民眾的申請；另，民眾到戶政事務所申請補換領戶籍謄本、國民身分證、戶口名簿、門牌證明、鋁製門牌，免收規費。
臺南市政府開設救災捐款專戶並強調，所有捐款將專款專用，用於協助受災民眾生活重建與基本所需，並定期公布捐款使用明細，確保公開透明，讓善心資源發揮最大效益，誠摯邀各界發揮愛心，為災民伸出援手；捐款連結：「https://donate.tainan.gov.tw/web/donation/donation_project_in.jsp?np_id=NP1751973941614」(請註明：「0706丹娜絲颱風災害捐款」)。(臺南市政府提供照片)
